channel.title: Daily Feed (Updated 9 AM BD)
channel.description: Daily Feed (Updated 9 AM BD) generated by script

item.title: Critical minerals: Why fast-tracking undermines democratic legitimacy
item.description: With mineral projects taking years to move from exploration to production, Australia must hasten carefully.

item.title: Donald Trump Should Stick to His Guns on Venezuela
item.description: The U.S. president was right to resist regime change before, and he should do so again now.

item.title: From Kabul to Kyiv, Trump’s pattern is clear – negotiate with enemies, sideline allies
item.description: Australia and other partners must plainly see that America’s commitment to defending democracies is fading fast.

item.title: Can Chinese Authoritarianism Stay Smart?
item.description: Beijing’s continued economic growth depends on a fragile balance of control and freedom.

item.title: How Russia tried to manipulate Moldova's election – and what it reveals
item.description: Small states aren’t destined to remain passive targets when faced with sophisticated influence operations.

item.title: Top U.S. Military Officials Meet With Caribbean Leaders
item.description: The meetings come as the Trump administration weighs next steps in its pressure campaign against Venezuela.

item.title: Senior U.S. Military Officials Visit the Caribbean
item.description: The meetings come as the Trump administration weighs next steps in its pressure campaign against Venezuela.

item.title: This bodge-it budget does not give Britain what it needs
item.description: Without ambitious reform, the country will not thrive

item.title: House Republicans Slam Witkoff Over Handling of Russia-Ukraine Talks
item.description: Republican opposition to the Trump administration’s chaotic approach to Russia-Ukraine negotiations is growing.

item.title: How to avoid an unjust peace in Ukraine
item.description: If Ukraine and Europe want to control their destiny they must seize the initiative

item.title: The Outlook for the US Economy in 2026
item.description: Although there was a massive boom in AI-related investments in 2025, policy-induced uncertainties and disruptions to official data releases clouded the picture. With a new year fast approaching, the US economy could find itself on one of three possible paths, with the most likely scenario also being the most positive.

item.title: Ethiopia-Eritrea Tensions Trigger Fears of a Fresh Regional Conflict
item.description: Addis Ababa’s quest for Red Sea access has led to a wave of hostile rhetoric.

item.title: How to short the bubbliest firms
item.description: Private markets present fearsome challenges

item.title: The Yellow Line in Gaza Is Supposed to Be Temporary. Israel Is Digging in.
item.description: Unless Hamas disarms, Israeli troops are unlikely to withdraw further.

item.title: Trump’s Dizzying Ukraine Diplomacy
item.description: The U.S. president is optimistic about a peace deal, but major obstacles remain.

item.title: Will Pope Leo Stand Up to Christian Nationalism?
item.description: A clash of visions on human dignity and divine purpose.

item.title: FP’s 2025 Holiday Gift Guide
item.description: Treats and treasures from around the world.

item.title: Donald Trump’s revenge agenda is not going well
item.description: So far, the courts are largely holding fast against politically motivated prosecutions

item.title: What Is ‘the West’?
item.description: The idea of a cohesive West is fading, but a new book finds that the concept endures.

item.title: Why China is pulling ahead in the robotaxi race
item.description: Government enthusiasm and cheap technology are giving it an edge

item.title: The TV Show That Divided Taiwan
item.description: Even imagining a potential Chinese invasion of the island has become a political act.

item.title: Iran Can’t Run Away From Tehran’s Disasters
item.description: Moving the capital is an old idea and a perennial nonstarter.

item.title: When LLMs learn to take shortcuts, they become evil
item.description: The fix is to use some reverse psychology when training a model

item.title: A new way to generate electricity from water
item.description: An age-old technique updated with futuristic materials

item.title: Can Compromises Create a Sovereign Ukraine?
item.description: Successful peace negotiations require concessions. The right ones will strengthen the West.

item.title: The writings of John Parker
item.description: A selection of his most memorable articles

item.title: Trump’s Stab in the Back
item.description: Reading like it was dictated by the Kremlin, the Trump administration's latest "peace" plan for Ukraine would have dire implications not only for that country, but also for Europe and the rest of the world. The message is simple and unmistakable: Now that it stands for nothing, the United States can easily be bought.

item.title: Investors expect AI use to soar. That’s not happening
item.description: Recent surveys point to flatlining business adoption

item.title: Fixing America’s Self-Inflicted Infrastructure Crisis
item.description: Thousands of infrastructure projects across the United States are mired in red tape, driving up prices and eroding Americans’ quality of life. The solution is not more technology or consultants, but rather rebuilding government capacity by hiring and retaining skilled engineers to manage projects efficiently and control costs.

item.title: Don't Let Trump Sell Out Ukraine
item.description: US President Donald Trump’s Ukraine peace plan is a non-starter for anyone who believes in the rule of law and supports European security. As negotiators continue to revise the terms, Europe must make clear that it will support Ukraine in opposing any deal that rewards Russian aggression.

item.title: Trump's Ukraine Peace Plan Threatens Europe
item.description: Whatever changes Ukrainian negotiators manage to wrest out of US officials, there is no question that President Donald Trump’s peace plan represents a strategic defeat not only for Ukraine, but for all of Europe. Rather than blaming Trump, however, Europeans need to take responsibility for their role in creating this situation.

item.title: Don’t believe everything you read in the media about Japan’s strong anti-immigrant sentiment
item.description: Social pressure pushes people to sound tougher on immigrants than they feel.

item.title: What’s Behind the New India-France Defense R&D Pact?
item.description: India and France are embarking on a new phase in their bilateral strategic cooperation.

item.title: The Variables of OPCON: What ‘Conditions’?
item.description: A look at how the definition of “Conditions-based OPCON Transition” has evolved over time.

item.title: Never Say Never: The Coming Rapprochement of Taiwan and Elon Musk?
item.description: Changing geopolitics and tech supply chain competition may bring the two back from estrangement sooner rather than later. After all, they really need each other.

item.title: Jair Bolsonaro is jailed, leaving the Brazilian right fractured
item.description: His son’s actions have not helped

item.title: A Perpetrator’s Peace
item.description: From Nagorno-Karabakh to Gaza, Trump’s approach to conflict resolution has rewarded aggression and perpetuated ethnic cleansing.

item.title: What Intensified Trade With China Has Meant for Border Communities in Kazakhstan
item.description: While border areas in eastern Kazakhstan have experienced a boom in economic activities, local community concerns and experiences remain widely neglected.

item.title: China’s Low Rights Model Goes Global
item.description: China achieved manufacturing dominance thanks to its weaker protections for workers, communities, and the environment. Now it’s exporting that model.

item.title: ‘Autocracy 2.0’: How China Reinvented Tyranny for the Innovation Age
item.description: Insights from Jennifer Lind.

item.title: Trump’s Deportations Threaten the US Relationship With the Pacific, and China Seeks to Capitalize
item.description: Increased deportations and unequal and growingly restrictive visa policies are jeopardizing the trust built by decades of hosting Pacific Islanders – while China moves in the opposite direction.

item.title: China and Russia Seek to Deepen Defense and Security Cooperation
item.description: Do not cling to hopes that either China or Russia will moderate the other.

item.title: Strategic Priorities for ASEAN’s Newest Member
item.description: Membership of ASEAN brings Timor-Leste political visibility and economic opportunity, but also new exposure to disputes.

item.title: China’s ‘White Paper’ Protests: 3 Years Later
item.description: More than 100 people were arrested over the White Paper protests. Three years later, the status of many of those people remains unknown.

item.title: The Top 10 Reasons to Be Thankful in 2025
item.description: These are trying times—but there's still plenty to be grateful for in the world.

item.title: Pakistan: Entrenchment of the Pretorian Guard
item.description: The 27th Amendment severely undermines democracy, reshapes the military chain of command, and weakens civilian oversight of Pakistan’s nuclear arsenal.

item.title: America’s New Jim Crow
item.description: Far from continuing to advance racial equality, the Supreme Court and the Trump administration are actively dismantling it. While they are not advocating the outright racial apartheid of the Jim Crow era, they are embracing the discriminatory logic that made it possible.

item.title: Climate Change, COP30, and Where the World Goes From Here
item.description: Energy analyst Peter Kiernan says the conference wasn’t all bad but emission targets are unlikely to be met.

item.title: Gaza Peacekeeping: Pakistan’s Delicate Balancing Act Between the US and the Muslim World
item.description: Pakistani Defense Minister Asif has declared publicly that Pakistan will not participate in any arrangement that involves disarming Hamas.

item.title: India’s Strategic Autonomy Is Now Reading as Aloof
item.description: Why 2025 has been Modi's most difficult foreign-policy year.

item.title: Lessons From Los Alamos
item.description: America has the most to lose from restarting nuclear testing.

item.title: America Unbound in the Caribbean
item.description: The real costs of Washington's use of force.

item.title: As Bengal Elections Near, a Battle Over Bengali Patriotic Songs Grows Shriller
item.description: The BJP is using the 150th anniversary of India’s national song, "Vande Mataram," to polarize society and win votes.
